projects.name: WeTransfer Platform
projects.short_descr: Global consumer and B2B platform delivering large-scale file sharing and creative collaboration products used by millions of users worldwide.
projects.long_descr: WeTransfer is a global technology company best known for its file-sharing platform, serving millions of individual users and creative teams worldwide. Beyond simple file transfer, the company evolved into a multi-product ecosystem focused on creative productivity, collaboration, and content sharing, operating at significant consumer scale with strong emphasis on design quality and performance. During my tenure, WeTransfer supported 1M+ daily active users, with products spanning consumer-facing experiences and internal platform infrastructure shared across teams.

work_history.desc: Owned frontend platform architecture across multiple high-traffic products, focusing on shared UI foundations, developer experience, and long-term scalability. Operated at Staff level across product and platform teams while remaining hands-on in architecture and implementation.

Contributed to interviewing, onboarding, and defining platform standards and best practices

projects.name: Namely HR Platform
projects.short_descr: B2B HR, payroll, and benefits platform enabling mid-sized companies to manage employee data, compliance, and complex operational workflows.
projects.long_descr: Namely is a U.S.-based HR technology company providing an integrated platform for human resources, payroll, benefits administration, and compliance. The product serves mid-sized organizations with diverse workforce structures, requiring systems that can handle complex data models, regulatory constraints, and high expectations for accuracy and reliability. The platform operates in a data-intensive, high-stakes domain where frontend systems must support multi-step workflows, validation-heavy processes, and clear error handling for non-technical business users.

projects.name: Amelia AI Platform
projects.short_descr: Enterprise conversational AI platform enabling organizations to automate customer and employee interactions across text and voice channels.
projects.long_descr: Amelia (formerly IPsoft) is an enterprise AI company focused on intelligent automation and conversational AI solutions for large organizations. The platform enables businesses to deploy virtual assistants across customer service, HR, IT support, and internal operations, integrating with existing enterprise systems and workflows. During this period, Amelia was evolving from early chatbot-style deployments into a highly configurable, enterprise-grade AI platform, supporting complex dialog logic, multi-channel delivery, and strict accessibility and usability requirements.

work_history.desc: Built enterprise-grade frontend systems for configuring conversational AI workflows, translating complex dialog logic into usable interfaces for non-technical users. Operated at the intersection of frontend engineering and applied AI systems.
responsibilities: Built React-based conversational UI for enterprise customers
Collaborated with Cognitive Engineers to design dialog configuration workflows
Developed frontend architecture supporting branding and multi-tenant deployments
achievements: Implemented accessible UI patterns including keyboard and assistive-technology support
Designed BPMN-inspired UI components for visual dialog configuration
Supported enterprise deployments, contributing to adoption across 20+ clients

projects.status: Rebranded to Amelia (2020) → Acquired by SoundHound AI (2024)

projects.name: Sophia Learning Platform
projects.short_descr: Online education platform delivering scalable, credit-eligible courses with accessible, responsive learning experiences for a broad student audience.
projects.long_descr: Sophia Learning is an online education platform offering self-paced, college-level courses designed to be affordable, accessible, and transferable through partnerships with higher-education institutions. The product serves a large and diverse student base, requiring reliable performance, strong accessibility standards, and responsive design across devices. During this period, Sophia Learning was scaling its platform and expanding course offerings, placing increasing demands on frontend architecture, usability, and cross-team coordination.

work_history.desc: Owned frontend and full-stack delivery for responsive, accessible learning flows, assessments, and course navigation in a fast-scaling education platform.
responsibilities: Structured large, jQuery-based codebases for maintainability and reuse
Implemented responsive layouts at a time when mobile-first design was still emerging
Built interactive learning flows supporting assessments, progress tracking, and course navigation
Implemented accessible UI patterns and semantic markup
Ensured keyboard navigation and screen-reader compatibility
Aligned frontend behavior with evolving accessibility standards
Collaborated closely with backend and product teams to balance performance with usability

projects.name: Candena Training Platform
projects.short_descr: B2B EdTech platform delivering customizable online training systems for enterprises and universities, with white-label theming and modular learning workflows.
projects.long_descr: Candena was a Berlin-based EdTech SaaS company building scalable online learning platforms for enterprises and academic institutions. The product supported long-running, mentor-led learning programs with assignments, evaluations, and team-based collaboration, requiring flexible configuration and strong support for client-specific branding. The platform served multiple organizations with distinct requirements, making reusability, configurability, and maintainability core product concerns from an early stage.

work_history.desc: Owned frontend architecture and modernization for a B2B EdTech platform, evolving a legacy Rails application into a configurable, white-label system. Led frontend direction while continuing hands-on development.
responsibilities: Led frontend modernization of a legacy Rails application
Delivered modular SPA frontends while maintaining the legacy system
Introduced greenfield React application for new workflows
Established frontend standards, CI pipelines, and workflows
Acted as technical lead supporting hiring, onboarding, and planning
achievements: Designed a fully themeable UI system enabling white-label deployments
Defined frontend architecture and API integration patterns improving scalability
Improved delivery quality across a distributed team through documentation and reviews

projects.name: KL82 Commercial Web Projects

The studio worked with local and regional clients across industries, building marketing sites, e-commerce platforms, and interactive experiences during the early evolution of modern web development. Projects were delivered by small, fast-moving teams, requiring engineers to operate across the full stack — from UI and backend logic to deployment and server configuration.
